Manipulator.Driver_Interface.Command_Parameters module#

class Manipulator.Driver_Interface.Command_Parameters.Command_Parameters#

Bases: object

UPID = Command_Parameter(description='UPID', type=linType(format='H', byte_size=2), unit='', conversion_factor=1)#
acceleration_not_signed = Command_Parameter(description='acceleration', type=linType(format='I', byte_size=4), unit='m/s^2', conversion_factor=100000.0)#
deceleration = Command_Parameter(description='Deceleration', type=linType(format='I', byte_size=4), unit='m/s^2', conversion_factor=100000.0)#
demand_acceleration = Command_Parameter(description='Demand acceleration', type=linType(format='i', byte_size=4), unit='mm/s^2', conversion_factor=100.0)#
demand_position = Command_Parameter(description='Demand position', type=linType(format='i', byte_size=4), unit='mm', conversion_factor=10000.0)#
demand_velocity = Command_Parameter(description='Demand velocity', type=linType(format='i', byte_size=4), unit='mm/s', conversion_factor=1000.0)#
maximal_velocity = Command_Parameter(description='Maximal velocity', type=linType(format='I', byte_size=4), unit='m/s', conversion_factor=1000000.0)#
target_position = Command_Parameter(description='Target position', type=linType(format='i', byte_size=4), unit='mm', conversion_factor=10000.0)#
timer_value = Command_Parameter(description='Slave timer value', type=linType(format='i', byte_size=4), unit='mym', conversion_factor=1)#
velocity_not_signed = Command_Parameter(description='velocity', type=linType(format='I', byte_size=4), unit='m/s', conversion_factor=1000000.0)#
velocity_signed = Command_Parameter(description='velocity', type=linType(format='i', byte_size=4), unit='m/s', conversion_factor=1000000.0)#

Manipulator.Driver_Interface.Drivers module#

exception Manipulator.Driver_Interface.Drivers.DriveError(drive: Driver, error_code: int, post_message: str = '')#

Bases: Exception

class Manipulator.Driver_Interface.Drivers.Driver(IP: str, name: str, datagram: linUDP, monitoring_channel_parameters: tuple[Command_Parameter | None] = (None, None, None, None))#

Bases: object

acknowledge_error() → None#
get_MC_count() → int#
get_driver_time() → float#
get_main_state() → int#

Gets the main state of the drive.

Returns:

The main state of the drive.

Return type:

int

get_realtime_config_command_count() → int#
get_status_word() → int#
home(timeout: float = 30) → bool#

Sends a command to home the LinMot motors. The drive must be in state 8.

Parameters:

timeout (float, optional) The time (s) to wait before the homing procedure is considered failed. Default is 30s.

Returns:

Whether or not the procedure ended succesfully.

Return type:

bool

static ignored_if_awaiting_error_acknowledgement(method: Callable[[T], R]) → Callable[[T], R | None]#
initialize_stream(stream_type: Literal['P', 'PV', 'PVA']) → None#
move_with_constant_velocity(velocity: float) → tuple[float, float]#
static run_on_driver_thread(method: Callable[[T], R]) → Callable[[T], Future]#

The decorator method which methods will be put into the class thread queue.

send(request: Request, max_attemps: int = 5) → Translated_Response#
Parameters:

  • request (Request) The request to send to the drive.

  • MC_count (int, optional) The count of the motion command. Must be different than the previous motion command otherwise it is ignored by the drive.

  • realtime_config_command_count (int, optional) The count of the realtime config command. Must be different than the previous command otherwise it is ignored by the drive.

  • attempt (int, optional) The attempt number for the request. Should not be used.

Returns:

A dict containing the translated response from the drive. Content depends on the request.

Return type:

IO.Translated_Response

Raises:

TimedOutError If no response is recieved after 5 attempts.

stop_stream() → None#
stream(target_position: float, target_velocity: float | None = None, target_acceleration: float | None = None) → None#
switch_on(timeout: float = 5) → bool#

Switches on the drive by setting the main state to 8 from either state 0 or 2.

Parameters:

timeout (float, optional) The time (s) to wait before considering the switch on procedure failed.

Returns:

Whether or not the procedure ended succesfully.

Return type:

bool

wait_for_change(change_checker: Callable[[None], bool], timeout: float, delay: float = 0.0) → bool#

Procedure that waits for a given change to happen in the drive.

Parameters:

  • change_checker (Callable[[None], bool]) The criteria to check at delay intervals.

  • timeout (float) The amount of time to wait for the change to happen before considering the change to not happen.

  • delay (float, optional) The time between checking the criteria. Default is as fast as possible.

exception Manipulator.Driver_Interface.Drivers.Monitoring_Channel_Missing_Parameter_Error(missing_parameter_name: str)#

Bases: Exception
